intro: Ferula badhysi, commonly known as the Kashmiri ferula, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their antispasmodic and digestive properties. Ferula badhysi thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters.
